title: How to Make Blueberry Doughnuts

steps.headline: Mix the wet ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the milk, butter, eggs, and extracts with a stand or hand mixer.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Use a medium bowl to combine the sugar, flour, baking powder, and salt with a metal wire whisk.

steps.headline: Incorporate the two bowls.
steps.description: Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring.

steps.headline: Fold the blueberries in gently until fully incorporated.
Fill a doughnut pan.
steps.description: Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 1/2 to 2/3 full.

steps.headline: Bake the doughnuts for 10 to 12 minutes.
Allow the doughnuts to cool.
steps.description: Leave them in the pan for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Combine the frosting ingredients together.
steps.description: In a small bowl, use a metal wire whisk to thoroughly whip everything until you achieve a smooth mixture.

steps.headline: Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.
Garnish the doughnuts.
steps.description: Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped blueberries.

text: Making the Batter Mix the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, beat the milk, butter, eggs, and extracts with a stand or hand mixer. Mix the dry ingredients. Use a medium bowl to combine the sugar, flour, baking powder, and salt with a metal wire whisk. Incorporate the two bowls. Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring. Fold the blueberries in gently until fully incorporated.  Baking the Doughnuts Fill a doughnut pan. Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 1/2 to 2/3 full. Bake the doughnuts for 10 to 12 minutes.  Allow the doughnuts to cool. Leave them in the pan for a few minutes. Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack. Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes. Making and Applying the Frosting Combine the frosting ingredients together. In a small bowl, use a metal wire whisk to thoroughly whip everything until you achieve a smooth mixture. Dip the doughnuts into the frosting.  Garnish the doughnuts. Before the frosting sets, sprinkle some chopped blueberries.
